findings.message: The claim that `@utility ring-gate-ink { --tw-ring-color: var(--gate-ink); }` automatically enables `focus:ring-gate-ink/20` is likely incorrect; `/20` is typically generated from theme color utilities, not a one-off custom class, so focus ring styling may silently not apply.
The plan says inline-disable fallback for ring syntax is "not needed or permitted," but `line 362` explicitly allows that fallback. This internal contradiction makes execution/acceptance ambiguous.

Acceptance requires `:root` aliases like `--gate-ink: hsl(var(--color-fg))`, but the mitigation at `line 359` switches to fully computed values (`--gate-ink: hsl(0 0% 10%)`) and different utility usage. Acceptance criteria should include this fallback path explicitly.
The previously-missing `tracking-[0.2em]` mapping is now covered via `tracking-label-xs`, which resolves a real migration gap.
